timeline.bodyText: Do you plan to only run the Jakarta 9 ones with lite mode?
timeline.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: Typically when I move these over, I set them to run only EE9 in lite, and everything in full. However; if I recall correctly these were written so that pretty much everything is run in full. I didn't change that, so making it so that only EE9 ran in lite would really have no consequence.
replies.author: jvanhill

timeline.bodyText: No repeats for Jakarta 9?  I saw the bnd file said it was going to test faces-3.0
timeline.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: The FATs were originally all in one bucket, and took ~1.5 hours to run end to end in FULL mode (and overran the trace limit by quite a bit), and I didn't want to add another 1.5 hours. So I spoke with @utle and we picked a few of the FATs that represented a good coverage and then split the bucket into 3 buckets to get them each around 30 mins and below the trace output limit for the bucket.
replies.author: jvanhill

replies.bodyText: (I think this is the bucket that didn't have one FATs we picked for EE9 repeat)
replies.author: jvanhill

replies.bodyText: The tested features is probably b/c I got them all running first and then split the buckets by copying from the original bucket. I can remove that tested.features.
replies.author: jvanhill

timeline.bodyText: No need for this code since we don't support Java 7 any longer.
timeline.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: I got rid of the JDK_V7_LOWER field in InitClass, which meant I could remove the testS4U2SelfJDKVersionComplianceTest test in S4U2SelfTest.java.
replies.author: jvanhill

replies.bodyText: I also removed this from the two other FATSuite classes as well.
replies.author: jvanhill
